website_summaries.verdict: An attractive running shoe that packs the greatest amount of value for a lower price.
pros: These shoes stand out for the triangle-shaped patterning on the sole that feels sturdy and secure during activities
cons: each, these shoes are a bit heavy, and users can feel it

customer_reviews.title: BEST jogging shoes ever.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Saucony for 30 years. Thru the years have tried different brands. These shoes always fit and work perfect for me. I have wide forefoot. Narrow heel. High arch. The best running, trail, jogging, walking shoes made.
customer_reviews.author: 2123dtgo

customer_reviews.title: So awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Saucony are the best and most durable running shoes out there. I love these and I cannot believe the price! They also make me about an inch taller! Don't let the price fool you. They absolutely live up to the Saucony name. These are fabulous!!! I have a difficult time with sneakers because I have a narrow heel and a wide forefoot. These are perfect! Thank you Saucony! You exceeded my expectations once again! The first pair I bought in 1994 got me all the way through basic training and then lasted several years beyond that! Seriously! I'm rough on shoes, but Sauconys last longer than any sneaker I've ever worn. They also help with my back and knee pain.
customer_reviews.author: Aliblank

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe at a great price. I love Saucony brand. I work on my feet 50 hours per week and tore the plantar fascia tendon in my foot a few years ago and Saucony is the only brand with the proper drop and proper fit to keep my feet happy and pain free. As to sizing go up one size from a standard sandal or loafer. Compared to other athletic shoes though sizing is similar. Such a great buy I might need to buy another color.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn P

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge Saucony fan for many years now, my only problem is how expensive they've become, I was thrilled when I found these for the price. They are terrific, no breaking it period, very cushioney yet supportive, I always size 1/2 up for running shoes and they fit perfect. Very happy with my pleasure urchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Croshaw

customer_reviews.title: Like one person has said
customer_reviews.text: Something has changed with this shoe. The insole feels different. Like one person has said: "less contoured". It's like my heel is on a pillow and just in front of my pillow is a ledge that the area right in front of my heel does not like. It's hard to describe it. Whatever they did, they need to undo it for the next model! I have ran in Cohesions for years and this shoe is aggravating my plantar fasciitis making it worse!.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Zero arch support, runs extremely small.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointing. At least a size and a half too small, even though marked correctly as 7.5. ZERO, I mean ZERO, arch support, I used to get the Suacony Swerve, unforntunately can't get that anymore, they had nice support and heel stability, these felt stable at the heel, but might as well wear a Kleenex box for all the arch support, which is, you guessed it, NONE. I was hoping that I would have luck with these based on other reviewers' positive reports, but sadly no. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Mandoliv

customer_reviews.title: These are great. The soles aren't cushy
customer_reviews.text: These are great. The soles aren't cushy, but they are thick and it's been fantastic on my knees.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Not a typical Saucony
customer_reviews.text: This is normally my go to tennis shoe. I work on concrete floors all day and also walk inclined on the treadmill everyday, so I just knew these would be great but they feel hard inside the toe part...so the return isn't comfortable when walking. I am making them work...I had to go buy some inserts but I wouldn't order this same pair again. I am disappointed and was hoping the stress and fatigue would be alleviated from my feet, back, and legs but not this round.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon McCain

customer_reviews.title: Comfy from day one!
customer_reviews.text: Comfy from day one. These did not take any break in time. I always order up a half size for walking shoes or I end up with bruised big toes, something about the way I walk. If I was wearing for everyday casual wear I would order my true size. Comfortable and good support for my ankles. I have bought this brand repeatedly and have had good luck. I walk for about an hour 5 days a week so my shoes take a lot of use and abuse. These wear well and last several months before needing replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sober Boss

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many Saucony running shoes over the years for running and walking, but not the Cohesion. The Cohesion 10 does not have as much cushion as some of the other Saucony running shoes I've had. Not ideal, but acceptable since I use another insole with more "cush" to increase my comfort level. I do like the stability of this shoe. My foot stays more balanced and aligned with my walk. I usually wear a size 39, and ordered the shoe in a size 9. Good fit, especially with thicker socks. Overall, not a bad shoe, and just what I needed for my daily, fast walk each morning.
customer_reviews.author: DoxieLover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new shoes! The size is just right, I usually go up a size in Saucony, and the color was just as expected. I often get cramps in my foot pad area and I have found that some shoes exacerbate that condition. Not these, they are plenty wide along the toe box, but not overly loose everywhere else. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Cluffmama

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. I went with the reviews and ordered a half size up, glad I did. I usually wear size 10 but ordered a size 10 1/2. Glad I did. The shoes are darker then what I thought but love them.
customer_reviews.author: Springer

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth or sixth pair Saucony Trail Runners and I have no intention of shifting to another shoe. I am training for a half marathon on a gravel ORV trail and the one aspect of my body that never hurts after a run is my feet! I add some Dr. Scholl's Active inserts to help with cushioning and transition the shoes for walking after about 300 to 400 miles. Very durable - I've only actually worn out a pair of these once.
customer_reviews.author: Soaring Gull

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great walking shoes! The size is just perfect and the shoes gives great arch support. I literally took them out of the box and went on a 2mi walk without any problem. This is my second pair of Saucony shoes and you can never go wrong! I love the colors, the gray looks like can hide some dust easily, and the vibrant green shines enough that helps you feel awake in the morning :) Great pair of shoes that can be taken everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: dd

customer_reviews.title: Not as Good as Previous Cohesion Styles
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big Saucony fan, so after having several Cohesion versions, I decided to go with this one. I don't like the sole as much as my other ones (the photo looks more like my previous shoes than the shoe I got) as this one has a more flat sole rather than the lifted arch sole, and the top doesn't feel as comfortable and roomy as the previous versions. There isn't a 'rocking' feel to the step anymore; not sure why they wanted this one to go south of all the advantages of the others, but it just doesn't meet up to par with previous Cohesion styles.
customer_reviews.author: BluesHeart

customer_reviews.title: So thankful I tried these!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so thankful! I have been suffering with plantar fasciitis in my right foot for over a year. I have tried so many shoes of all types. The afternoon these came in the mail I had been on my feet all day (I work in a medical office). My foot was throbbing. I tried these on and they were instantly supportive in all the right places and my pain just stopped!! I have been wearing them ever since. They fit true to size (9B) and are extremely lightweight. I just added another color to my wishlist.
customer_reviews.author: AnjinDenver

customer_reviews.title: Finally a sneaker that doesn’t strangle my feet.
customer_reviews.text: I am a true 7.5 medium. I ordered an 8 after reading the reviews! Glad I did, it’s perfect. I am also a sock person. Would rarely wear a sneaker without! When they arrived I was skeptical mainly because of a bunion and I live in Spenco flip flops. For those of you who don’t know about thoes, They are super supportive like merrels and birkenstocks. So I am real picky about support! The colors were nice, Soles did not feel like stilts. and they are light weight ! ( My carry on thanks You ) The only thing I did not like was the long laces. I may replace with smaller ones. Well made ! Hope they last!

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Reasonably Priced
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand of shoes for myself! The quality is always good and the price is very reasonable. I wear a size 8 but have a very slightly wide foot and this brand has always fit very comfortably. This particular pair seems to have somewhat of a higher and firmer arch than the other styles I have worn. I will keep them and hopefully I will get used to this different arch which I find somewhat uncomfortable right now.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: They have RUINED the Cohesion line!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Saucony cohesions for many years now and loved them all. But this new Cohesion 10 was the worst! They felt like cheap plastic shoes from Walmart instead of springy supportive Sauconies I've become used to. Whatever they did to change this model up was a big mistake. I returned all four pair.
customer_reviews.author: M. T. Ireland

customer_reviews.title: Order small
customer_reviews.text: I have sacucony TR9 size 10 wide. They are a little big in length and width so I ordered a 9.5d in these. I could have gone down at least another .5 size! Even with my custom orthotics. Nice color. My finger is at the end of my big toe. You can see how tight I had to pull them and they still are too wide.
customer_reviews.author: Beachgirl

customer_reviews.title: Who's been wearing my shoes?
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand of shoe. They always fit well and my feet dont and up hurting like with other brands I've tried. The product itself is great but when I recieved my shoes they were clearly worn by someone and not brand new. There was dirt on the soles as if someone had worn them bit before and even had small pebbles still stuck in the tree. There was hair (animal, I think) inside the shoe and they did not smell new. They did not even come in the original box, just a plain brown cardboard box. I'm pleased with my product but not the condition I recieved them in.
customer_reviews.author: melodous

customer_reviews.title: I have big wide flat feet and painful bunions. These are comfortable right out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I am literally so grateful these shoes came into my life. I have big wide flat feet and painful bunions. These are comfortable right out of the box. There is no pressure on my bunion and the sole of the shoe is just so comfortable. As I nurse, I am on my feet all day. These shoes are so comfortable. Buy them. You won’t be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: erica

customer_reviews.title: Been with Saucony my entire running experience
customer_reviews.text: I've been running since I was twenty, so that's forty-eight years of running shoes! I discovered Saucony in my late twenties, tried something else once, regretted it, and returned to the tried and true. Sauconys are well made, fit as expected, are pretty affordable, and last (I change mine out once/year running about 20 miles per week). Of course, running shoes are a somewhat personal choice, so they may not be for you, but I love them, and my next pair will be Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Foard

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ordered true to size, after trying and shoe at Rack Room. Amazon's color choices wetter so much better. But they kill my feet. I've worn then twice on on long walks and my feet ache all day afterwards. Then I gave it a couple of days tried again, same. I don't know if I can return them? Amazon says I have to check edith the 3rd party seller? Their comments were to check with amazon. I need a new different shoe this one just doesn't feel comfortable like my 3 other past saucony shoes.
customer_reviews.author: XMarksTheSpot!

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cushioning, excellent ventilation, and they don't look like a dowdy walking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I went through a number of different shoe options trying to find something that would stand up to two full weeks of constant walking throughout European cities, and these shoes really fit the bill. Great breathability, excellent cushioning, stood up well to cobblestones and rainy slick streets, and they look so much chicer than a lot of other cushiony shoes out there. I took this pair along with another pair on my trip and used the other pair once; this pair was the preferred pair I used for the other 13 days. Really pleased with these shoes and strongly recommend them if you do a lot of walking. So glad I found these before we left.
customer_reviews.author: vix

customer_reviews.title: Extra Arch Support in these guys!
customer_reviews.text: These are great - like all the other Saucony running shoes they are comfortable, lightweight and comfy. I typically wear a wide, and these fit true to size for Saucony (ordered 8 wide, fit like other styles from the brand). The one thing to note is that these have great arch support - so much so that they actually feel uncomfortable when I wear them using my typical supportive insert (for my Plantar Factitious). The older style "Cohesion" did not have that problem. Otherwise, these are exactly what you'd expect from Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: So great for a high arched foot!
customer_reviews.text: I used to wear Saucony shoes for running almost exclusively - one of the few that really worked on my supinated feet. Then they changed and the last was too straight for my rigid foot. And I'm not one to spend a gazillion dollars on my shoes since I'm walking more than running these days, and I just don't see why some of the shoes should be so expensive! Really happy with the fit of these shoes an immediately ordered a second pair. I also have a narrow heel - and no slippage!!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Not Just for Running
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my morning walking routine. I'm out for several miles, and though I don't run anymore, I do walk briskly for over an hour every morning. Saucony is a brand I discovered in the '90s, when I was running and training for marathons. I had fond memories of their durability, so I got these for my walking and I'm glad I did. They are roomy, so the orthotic insole I got (also from Amazon) slips in on top of the factory insole and the sneakers fit quite well. This just goes to show that one can still get a good pair of shoes without paying into the three-figures for them! (And we can avoid buying Nike!)
customer_reviews.author: Beth Mason in NC

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoes in the past were the Brooks Ghost
customer_reviews.text: In the past I have only purchased my running shoes through a certified walk-in store, but after seeing the much cheaper price Amazon provided, I had to check it out. My favorite shoes in the past were the Brooks Ghost, which provide the ultimate comfort for long distance runners. Recently, however, I had been on the lookout for more supportive shoes and these definitely fit the bill. Not only are these affordable for the value, they are also stylish and extremely comfortable. If you are looking for a long distance running pair of shoes, don't hesitate to try these!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Just kind of meh
customer_reviews.text: I'm not thrilled with these shoes and will be purchasing a different pair after giving these about 2 months of everyday wear. My last pair of Saucony were amazing and I literally wore them out. This pair just doesn't fit the same or offer the same comfort. The foot bed feels harder and less cushiony. The back ankle is narrow and seems to cause my achilles pain. The tongue is too long and digs into the front of my ankle. In general, the price is good and the durability is there but the comfort is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Lotta bang for your buck here.
customer_reviews.text: I think I liked the Cohesion 8s better, but these are still good. Purchased in both the bright blue and the grey/mint so I can alternate their use and preserve them a little better than my old 8s. I need a neutral cushioned running shoe and these fit the bill. I order up 1/2 size from my day to day & fashion shoes to make sure I have enough room in the toebox to prevent blisters.
customer_reviews.author: LMB

customer_reviews.title: The Only Shoe Model I Buy
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I also purchased the dark blue pair and I love them. Hoping two pairs will help with increasing longevity since the newer versions are narrow. I have wide feet. 5 years ago I bought first pair of Saucony shoes. 8.5 W fit perfectly in a Size 9. The reason why I only buy the Cohesion 10 is because the newer models look different, specifically the toe part is flatter in the later models, thus doesn't fit my wide feet well. Once these wear out, I'm not sure what I'll do, since stock is low on them everywhere. :P. I use these for walking, running and HIIT. Love them! The only activewear shoes I buy!
customer_reviews.author: TeacherGal94

customer_reviews.title: Not good shoes for speed walking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my wife thinking the Saucony brand would be a good shoe investment. My wife found them to not be a very comfortable shoe to walk in, we are not runner but we speed walk for exercise. How it strikes the pavement hurts her knee. I purchased a mens pair of the Cohesion 10's also and I am experiencing the same. I also found the toe box in the men's is wide and my foot rubs which is another point of discomfort. They may be good shoes for runners but they are definitely not a walking shoe. As for the quality, the shoe's are well made and of good material.
customer_reviews.author: CWStew

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough For Fussy Duck Feet
customer_reviews.text: I usually go into Big 5 and try on a bunch of shoes before I choose, but they are being militant about masks, so I won't be shopping there anymore. Amazon it is. My feet are skinny in the ankle and wide in the toe box, and these work well enough. These are wide, which works for me, but probably not for really narrow feet. Cons: Not cushy They flex in a funny spot and press on my toes. They don't rub, but it bugs me a bit. Pros: Nice color Fit is precise. I'm a ten, these are a ten. The laces are thick and grippy.
customer_reviews.author: vulturebee

customer_reviews.title: Started off great, but caused foot problems later on
customer_reviews.text: I wear 10.5 wide and these shoes fit perfectly. No problems whatsoever until 4 months later. I have started having foot pain along the outer edge of my right foot. I think it's caused by the shape of the shoe. My other foot is just beginning to have pain, so I have ordered New Balance shoes. I'll update if the New Balance corrects the issue.
customer_reviews.author: McMorris

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but order up a size.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice shoes, but order up a size. I usually wear a 10M, had previously worn this exact shoe in a different color that was a 10M. These 10M shoes are way too small for me. Too short, too narrow. I can't wear them, so I returned them and will probably order the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Taraghostie

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought Saucony brand years ago and became an ardent fan. I especially loved the wide toebox. However, the last couple of purchases have missed the mark in several areas including poor workmanship, sizing and fit. Returnded this purchase and went to a cheaper but really well fitting brand that I found in an Academy retail store.
customer_reviews.author: Datsmar

customer_reviews.title: Fits great.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn many Saucony running shoes over the years and decided to try other brands since my shoe was no longer available. After trying about 2 dozen pair of runners, I finally went back to Saucony and ordered a wide shoe. Saucony's use to be wide enough for me without ordering a wide width, but that is no longer the case. The New Balance I bought at a store last month gives me awful blisters on the inside of my heel. So they now sit in my closet. I will update my review after I run in them for a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roomy Toe Box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in my normal size for athletic shoes and the fit is slightly large in length and width on me. I may be able to order a half size down, but we'll see. I am not complaining because I like a roomier fit rather than having my toes squeezed together. The color I choose was the least expensive. It's grey with a neon green and mint accent. The neon green is the part I'm not crazy about, but for the price I can live with it. It seem like a nice, lightweight, supportive shoe, with a bit of arch support. Maybe not the most stylish looking shoe, but they feel comfortable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Moonbeam

customer_reviews.title: Arch support and comfort is not there
customer_reviews.text: There was no arch support. I bought the exact same ones 5 years ago and the arch support was great with a great memory foam. The ones I recently purchased from Amazon did not have any arch support and the insole was like a cardboard
customer_reviews.author: l. joseph

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with shin splints? These will help!
customer_reviews.text: I am not an avid runner, but will maybe run 2-3 miles a few times a month. I've had shin splints my entire life and the pain can be excruciating at times. I have to switch out my running shoes in order to ensure they give my feet/shins continuous adequate support. These shoes have been a dream! It feels like walking/running on clouds. The arch support is perfect for my feet and I haven't had any issues with shin splints since wearing them. I'm super happy with this purchase and will definitely consider buying them a second time once this pair wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Young

customer_reviews.title: Good looking sneaker, unfortunately no cushion feel
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get these sneakers because my sneakers are so worn out and years old, they arrived quickly! However, when I put them on the "cushion" was surprisingly non existent. It was like putting my foot on bricks. I was so disappointed that I have to send them back. The color and style was as expected, the toe box roomy, just no cushion as the description said it would have. Very stiff sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Riker

customer_reviews.title: Wider than the normal fit
customer_reviews.text: This was a very well made supportive shoe with a nice arch support, however it runs wide at the heel and forefoot. The length runs true to size. After reading the reviews , I decided to order a half size bigger as suggested. Well, that was a mistake. It was way too long. Just order your normal size shoe. This shoe will not work for the narrow foot. I have an average width foot and the shoe was way too wide. Unfortunately I had to send them back. If you have a wide foot, this is the shoe for you.
customer_reviews.author: Subaru

customer_reviews.title: My 4th pair and will buy more!
customer_reviews.text: My fourth pair of Cohesion shoes and love them. I walk 10k 4 times a week and wear out a pair every 4+ months. The shoe holds up, but after about 400+ miles of wear, the cushioning compacts and it is time for a new pair for best comfort. I have tried Ride and Lancer but always return to Cohesion because I like the wider toe box, do not have any pronation issues and have only a very mild supination of the foot. The Lancer seemed to be better suited for someone with pronation concerns. There is a lot of value in these shoes for the price. For me, Cohesion/Saucony lasts as long as any $100+ pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn R

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but feet sweat in these
customer_reviews.text: I only wear these in the house for indoor workouts. They are very comfortable, but my feet sweat after a rigorous workout. I almost exclusively buy Saucony sneakers, as I find them to be extremely comfortable and a great value. That being said, I have never had a pair where my feet would sweat after workouts. I even wore a completely different kind of sock to see if that made a difference, but it didn’t. It’s not the end of the world, since I shower after the workout, but it may bother some people.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: NO CUSHION in these
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid Saucony lover and I've purchased so many of their shoes so I'm uber disappointed in these. There is zero cushion in these shoes. I just purchased them about a month ago and they actually hurt my feet now. I've never had a saucony hurt my feet. I would skip this shoe and save your money!
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes for the first time and now my feet hurt. Poor arch support, not enough cushioning. I will see if I can get shoe inserts to alleviate the problem. The construction of Saucony shoes used to be outstanding when they first hit the market. Now they scrimp on quality materials, I am disappointed. I purchased some insoles for running shoes and it has made all the difference. Saucony shoes used to have great cushioning but they have cut back on quality materials. I do not like that this trend is happening in just about all manufactured products.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia C.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned the excursion tr8 in size 6.5 and loved them. Sadly where i jog is uneven and my right shoe broke down before my left. I got these in a size 7 by mistake and am glad i did! They fit great but my normal 6.5 would have been too small. The toe room is a little tighter then the excursion tr8 but still comfortable. Very breathable. I got them yesterday and wore them today. These are the only shoes i have never had to 'break in' because they always have a perfect fit right from the start.
customer_reviews.author: dez

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing sauconys since the 90s and these are a poor pair half a size too small and narrow toe box I wear a 7.5 usually and this is the only sneaker in 7.5 that ran too small also not as well made as they use to be once they stopped being made in USA in 94 seems lacks quality I like the style a d colors but too small also I had to add my own insoles because the one it comes w is not too good so overall I would not purchase again and it's sad because I like the look
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as soon as I put them on
customer_reviews.text: Everyone's feet are different but as soon as I put these on they were perfectly cozy. I am a moderate exercise person and noticed the tread going on my asics. I looked for something that had fun colors, bright but not too over the top, and was under $100. The laces are not too long or too short (as were with my asics), the mesh has no pinching spots, the sole is very supportive. These fit the bill and more than met my expectations for comfort and looks.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Worn out in 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 6 weeks ago, ran 5-6 days a week for just 15 minutes or so a day (plus a few longer walks a week) They are goners, I tried to wear them for another week past when I knew they were already worn out. Treads are shot, heel support is shot, foam is already pancaking. I've been jogging in Saucony shoes for decades, and these are the fastest to wear out. Worried about future purchases of similar shoes.
customer_reviews.author: rosalie roberts

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good support, and great colors!
customer_reviews.text: This the second pair of this model (Saucony Cohesion) that I purchased. I have a hard time finding shoes that fit and are comfortable. When I bought my first pair of the Cohesion (mint/gray color) I knew it was perfect the second I put it on. Good support in the sole and arch with subtle but fun colors. After wearing them for several months I decided to get a second pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: pinkplumeria

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for walking
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes for walking at the gym. (It's winter here, so I have not tried them outside, but I'm sure they'll be great.) They feel so good on my feet, give great arch support, & enhance stability. They aren't too narrow across the top of my foot. I bought them a half size larger for a little extra toe room - just personal preference in a walking shoe. There is about an extra 1/2" at the end of my big toe. They look great on, and have reflective sections built into the design. This is my first pair of Saucony shoes, but will not be my last! Very pleased! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DaisyMae

customer_reviews.title: Durable for my tough little tomgirl
customer_reviews.text: I have had my sneakers for 3 years and wear daily. Granted I’m not playing sports full-time but I do play soccer, shoot basketball, throw football and run around bases playing softball with kids in yard and finally decided to order a pair for my daughter who goes through 2-3 pairs of these “kid brand sneakers” a school year that don’t last. She either ends up with a hole in the toe or sole separates from sneaker base and they cost anywhere from $60-$80. Her feet even sweat less in these. Fingers crossed for these to just make it through a whole school year and I’ll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not made for my feet
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe, but no good for my low arches. I usually wear asics, but tried these because the color was more neutral compared to most asics. The reviews were good so I gave them a try. Day one, my feet felt great. Day two, my arches felt a bit sore, Day three my feet were very sore. I they are well padded and have a high arch support, but this support might be too high for my flattish feet. I can only tolerate wearing them once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Running Shoe/Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I have never bought my running shoes online before for obvious reasons, but I've taken these out for a run a few times now, and I'm blown away. This is a high quality running shoe at such a reasonable price. There is great support in the heels and mid-foot, so no matter where you strike, you have stability and shock absorption. As in any good running shoe, the toe bed has nice flexibility. The tread is awesome, so I can use this on the road or on trails with slopes. It fits perfectly and looks really nice, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H.

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to start exercising to get rid of the dreaded 2020 20. I had been wearing the casual slip on shoes. I had forgotten how much zing a good running shoe can put into your step. The arch support and rounded sole make walking so much easier and more comfortable. Plus the colors are cute. They fit just as to be expected. Not too big, not too small -- just right! Love them!
customer_reviews.author: MEB

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable best shoe buy of the year
customer_reviews.text: I have been on the hunt for a pair of wide comfortable sneakers for a while, when I saw the bargain basement price on these Saucony, I knew I wasn't going to lose much either way. To my amazement, my wide feet breathed a sigh of relief. These shoes are comfortable ample space in the toe box area and I love that they are elevated so they make me look taller all in all a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LEJTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff for me
customer_reviews.text: My three star rating has nothing to do with Saucony in general . I have bought their shoes and had great results in the past . This time around however I was looking for a minimalist shoe for running . This is not a minimalist shoe. A running coach once told me that in order to run efficiently and injury free running shoes should be able to bend in the middle even slightly . That is impossible to do with the shoe so I returned it
customer_reviews.author: sassafrass66

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had four surgeries on my right foot. Finding shoes that don't hurt, have enough cushioning, support and are within my budget usually ends up with me being disappointed and frustrated. I looked at shoes online for weeks, writing down the pros and cons and reading lots of reviews. I finally decided to try these, and so far, I've been pleasantly surprised and without pain. I've only been wearing them for a week, so time will tell, but for now, I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Parry

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly as comfortable as my Saucony Cohesion 8
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as comfortable as my Saucony Cohesion 8, rather disappointed. Overall it is still a good shoe, but having had better experiences with previous Saucony's, I was a little bit disappointed. Maybe I just had too high of expectations, but I would definitely say they are not nearly as comfortable, cushioned, or supportive as the Cohesion 8's. They feel similar to any Nike's I've had previously, so they are still a good shoe, but not what I expected from Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: Dulcinea

customer_reviews.title: Fits a wide foot.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly, and for me, that is saying allot. My 40 years of running widened my feet. I also have a bunyon on my left foot. These shoes are wide enough for me. Saucony was always my favorite running shoe, and even though I can no longer run (3 hip replacements), they are my shoe of choice. Lucky to have found this one without trying it on in a store. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: hawaiidreamer

customer_reviews.title: Fits really small
customer_reviews.text: I am a dedicated saucony shoe buyer. I am always able to order my size and they always fit perfectly. This fit so small I thought they sent me the wrong size. Length and with were way off. I checked tag to make sure they are the right size and they were. Hoping it was an anomaly and I just got a weird shoe. I will buy a different line and not the Cohesion from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Wears out too quickly!
customer_reviews.text: This has been my favorite brand for a few years. I can always count on them to offer good support and fit well. However, within 5 months they were breaking down and there is now a lump that's popped up in the footbed and my back is hurting from wearing them so now I have to replace them. I've never had this happen before and I usually get at least a year out of them. I didn't even wear them a lot over the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for walking.
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable. I love them. Provides the support and cushion I need for my knees and hip. I had knee replacement surgery about 7 months ago and have been trying to walk more. And I thought I would try these as this was a brand recommended by my podiatrist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great support and good fit
customer_reviews.text: Just took them out of the box and tried on. Sooo good and cushion-y. I had some nasty injuries and am just starting to run again after quite some time. I have always worn Saucony. I ran the NY Marathon in them and they've always fit great. I took everyone's advice and got this model, Not the one I've worn in the past. They fit perfectly. I need a little room in the toe box and my feet and ankles swell due to my injuries, so I got a half size up from my 9.5. Glad I did it. Excited to run again!
customer_reviews.author: Leighkaren Labay

customer_reviews.title: Fabric already has holes after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I usually love my Saucony shoes and only buy this brand. However, this pair is shot and I have only had them for 2 months! The fabric in the heels is wearing through (so I’m trying to be inventive on how to patch them) and the fabric also has several holes on the inside step where you put in your foot. Very disappointing—think I’ll have to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good for crappy feet
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan for sure. I ordered a half a size bigger for some extra room but I definitely didn't have to. They're true to size. I overpronate and have really flat feet so I need decent heel and arch support. I also have weird toenails that pinch the skin on my toes if the toe box is too small, but these are perfect. I walked my mom's dog in them and they felt really comfortable. I'm looking forward to using these on the elliptical at the gym!
customer_reviews.author: HunisucklRose

customer_reviews.title: ALL TIME FAVORITES
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are my favorite. I where custom orthodics, and I was looking for a new shoe years ago. I went to a specialty store and these were recommended to me. I wore New Balance for years and I THOUGHT they were the best, I was wrong! The Saucony shoes are THE BEST. My feet feel great in these shoes. The cohesion style is perfect for orthodics (it is a neutral shoe) and the style is a VERY reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this for walking more than for running because of ...
customer_reviews.text: This tennis shoes are really soft and lightweight. I would recommend this for walking more than for running because of the design. Good material and cute colors
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Should accept as a return or a replacement for failure at 3/4 of a month use.
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart in a month and a half in normal everday conditions. There was zero running due to plantar fasciitis pain. Most wear was in the house on hardwood floors. It was not the only pair I ordered from amazon at the same time. So I only wore these half the time. So 3/4 a months wear and falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Rich D

customer_reviews.title: Fits Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: I tried these shoes on@ a DSW store before committing to buying. Yes, the were more extensive at the store. [Fifteen bucks more] Much better deal on amazon. I usually fit a 9.5. But since im a hefty gal with wide feet i decided to try on the 10s. Perfect fit! I adore the bits of fushia pink accents. My only issue... The padding isn't glued down. But i will still continue to use them.
customer_reviews.author: edensaid

customer_reviews.title: Ok!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! As far as the looks go. Today is my first day actually wearing them. I stood up then noticed they are not comfortable at all. Was in a hurry to work and since it matched my shirt, I had to leave it on. Being uncomfortable for 16 hrs.! Guess I have to put in my own cushion.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Good for about a month
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes when I first got them. I work retail, standing on concrete all day, and they were amazing. I could work an 8 hour shift and come home with no sore feet. But about after a month they just gave out. Now I can hardly wear them for 5 hours without my feet killing me. Worst part is I spent $60 on shoes I'm stuck with because I can't return them now.
customer_reviews.author: Jon and Tammy Wanzer

customer_reviews.title: a pair about every six months and these sneakers did not disappoint. The only minor issue is the "roll" that ...
customer_reviews.text: I buy a lot of Saucony's, a pair about every six months and these sneakers did not disappoint. The only minor issue is the "roll" that goes around your ankle on these seem a little fatter than I'm used to with the Saucony Guide 8 style that I was buying previously. It took me a couple of days to get used to it, but this style was less than half the price of the last pair of Guide 8's I bought so small sacrifice. I just don't tie them as tightly. Fits my orthodic inserts well. I would buy these again as long as the price point stays steady. I paid $39.95.
customer_reviews.author: CWalsh

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe has been GREAT! I have plantar fasciitis and have had trouble finding shoes with good support that work with orthotic insoles. This shoe works great. The heel cuff comes high enough and provides great support. Thanks Saucony!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for light workouts/ walking around town
customer_reviews.text: These are good shoes for light workouts or walking around town. Comfortable but not super supportive for running, especially if you're a little on the larger size (5'4"/ 160 lbs). I found that Acis gel venture 5 and 6 are way more supportive and better suited for really working out for me. These are ok, but after these wear out I will not be getting another set.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey C.

customer_reviews.title: Saucony! My favorite workout shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe. have tried Nike, Brooks, Converse, Puma, New Balance and always go back to Saucony. I wear a 8-1/2- 9 shoe, and ordered a 9-1/2, because I run (when the Boerboel says he is ready to go) they have a decent medium arch support and nice width. I use them daily walk/running the puppy. Have not tired Under Armour yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Q.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly uncomfortable and very cheap even considering the price. Arch support seems really strange. I got them for the last few months of my pregnancy since my shoes are pretty work down, but they still work a ton better than these. I forgot to return these within the 30 days and am now stuck with them. I'll be donating them since they are so terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Huth

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a comfy shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes. They are comfortable and the price cannot be beat! I had some other Saucony Cohesion that were supposed to be running shoes. They ended up being my everyday walkers. I love, love, love them. The only thing I don't like about this particular shoe is the white bottoms. I wish they were gray or black. White gets dirty so fast!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Happiest Vacations

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not breathable
customer_reviews.text: First time ever buying tennis shoes online and not needing to return it for wrong size or being uncomfortable. The fitting was spot on for being a size 10. Good support around the ankle and heel. The only negative thing I have to say is that the shoes don't breath very well. I'm already known for stinky feet and these don't help. I did have to add more comfortable insoles, but I am on my feet a lot at work.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Sneakers fit great and have been worn and walked in for many ...
customer_reviews.text: Sneakers fit great and have been worn and walked in for many miles. My only complaint is that they have started to show signs of significant wear after only 3 months and by 6 months need to be replaced. Threads are breaking and the mesh in the toe area is breaking down. I am very rough on my sneakers so for the average person these would be fine and I’m not even opposed to buying another pair for myself again. While these are not my La Sportivas they are overall a really good sneaker that are comfortable for everyday use and even some light walking trails (dirt roads, not actually hiking trails).
customer_reviews.author: Krys

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable & true to size
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, lightweight, great traction. Superb for running, aerobic workouts, circuit training whatever you love. Breatheable mesh, not waterproof, but excellent in every other way. Not obnoxiously colored like most women's workout shoes nowadays either. A bargain at $20 bucks I couldn't pass up, glad I took a chance. Great brand, have another, more colorful pair, but wanted something a bit less obvious to wear when not at gym...
customer_reviews.author: 5150hillbilly

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and super comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these a while back and they were great, so I was expecting similar when I got these. They are even more comfortable than their predecessors! I work in a warehouse and am on my feet for 10+ hours a day, and these support my arches and heels without pain. Highly recommend for anyone who is very active or on their feet a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: I have been running in Peregrines for like forever so I'm not 100% adjusted to these
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in Peregrines for like forever so I'm not 100% adjusted to these. I just wanted something with more cushioning but I don't feel like they have the trail response the Peregrines have and they seem like they have a weaker grip. They're OK for the price for easier trails or cross country type running, but I don't see them being used in the future on anything super technical.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Teague

customer_reviews.title: Healthier living !
customer_reviews.text: These are very good for walking .I started walking after work and to my surprise ,I've lost 4 1/2lbs in nine days.My doctor was so excited and encouraged me even more. My coachs are my 85 yrs old wonderful mother and my sister.The tip was to stop at the park before going home and just walk .I've found that this is very calming for me.I'm 5'8 and looking forward to my better and healthier living.
customer_reviews.author: Wegowoman

customer_reviews.title: ... extra wide feet it's always a challenge to find comfortable shoes. These are great
customer_reviews.text: With my extra wide feet it's always a challenge to find comfortable shoes. These are great! Fit well, and are wide in the toebox. Now, they do not have much support, so have inserts in them, but I find most shoes anymore, have no support to them. I am able to stand for hours in these shoes, without my feet hurting. Nice colors, too.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom of 7

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, good support
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this shoe. I have plantar fasciitis in my right foot and have been having trouble with other shoes. These feel good.
customer_reviews.author: M Grant

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sad but the local shoe store no longer sell this brand and it has been the best fitting and longest lasting sneaker for me. I'm a nurse so I'm on my feet all the time and used to go through sneakers like crazy these last for over a year before they start to break down. So very happy and thankful to find them on Amazon. Fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are ok comfy but I'm not sure that they'd be as comfortable for running
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 9.0 at first thinking they ran small. I normally wear an 8,5.... 9.0 was sloppy big for me. I returned/exchanged for the 8.5 which fits just right. I expected them to be a little more cushy, but they feel somewhat cheap in that they are thin and not cushy. They are ok comfy but I'm not sure that they'd be as comfortable for running. I wear them to work and to walk... work ok for that. The color is just as expected and they are pointy on the toe like some. I'm not sorry I bought them, but I wouldn't repeat the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: OkiemTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Made my sciatica worse
customer_reviews.text: My favorite shoe was the Saucony Ride 10, but they are no longer made. Before that I wore Asics or Nikes. I tried the Saucony ISO line, but the toe box was too narrow. The Cohesion 10 made a recent episode of sciatica worse. The shoes made my feet turn in. Not much cushion in these shoes. Returned and purchased Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: RSGTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: I don't know what happened this year. They must ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened this year. They must have tweaked the design from the past years. The arch or possibly the whole shoe is somehow different and the toe box seems narrower and shorter. I have been a fan of this particular shoe since 2011. Whatever they did, I hope they change it back from this. Until then, I will not be wearing this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Raphaela

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoe I own
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as new running shoes and they are so comfortable I've found myself wearing them all the time! They're great for work because I'm on my feet a lot and they transition great to workouts! I've never owned a pair of Saucony before, but after these wear out, I will definitely be buying another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These run small, so get at least a size larger than you normally wear. Love the comfort and look of this shoe. Second pair I have gotten. One minor issue. My foot eventually tends to slide to the toe in them, regardless of how I lace it. Suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Zooms

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not for long walks
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fit like hand in glove however the more I walked the more it hurt the bottom of feet. I have flat feet so that may have been the problem.
customer_reviews.author: trini

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: I like this brand of shoes as they are very supportive and I have numb feet with a bunion on one foot. Plus I do not want to pay over fifty dollars for a pair of athletic shoes. These shoes used to be made in the U.S. but are not anymore. I wish they still were as they are good shoes. This is my fourth pair and I will buy more. I buy a new pair twice a year: spring/summer and fall/winter. I don't think you will go wrong with your purchase of Saucony athletic shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi (WV)

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, but fabric tears
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe and comfortable but taking off 2 stars. The fabric on the top of the shoe/inner part of the ankle has started to rip on both shoes. It's March 30th and I started wearing them on March 3rd after delivery on the 2nd.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are nice shoes. They fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: These are nice shoes. They fit as expected, and they are very comfortable. The colors are bolder than depicted in the picture, which I like. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Manga Maniac Cafe

customer_reviews.title: They look to be good quality but too toe-pinching
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping these would be wide enough (I oredered 7.5 D). They look to be good quality but too toe-pinching. I had to return them. I gave them a four star because I just liked the way they looked and my feet are hard to fit. So, maybe someone else with wide feet would be happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bean

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes! I love my Saucony shoes for my daily walks. In Spring and Summer I wear Saucony tennis shoes wherever I go. This is the first time I bought a wide fit as I have corns on my little toes. These shoes fit perfectly and no more corn crush. I would recommend these shoes to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hartman

product_meta.title: Saucony Women's Cohesion 10 Running Shoe
product_meta.description:
The Cohesion 10 is your everyday training partner. Encased with excellent cushioning, flexibility, and comfort for crushing any activity, including conquering the longer roads ahead.Forefoot Stack Height: 17mm

Saucony is among the most respected names in running shoes. We offer a wide range of running and walking shoes, each with the Saucony trademark fit, feel and performance. We've spent years studying the biomechanics of top athletes. Our goal? To develop creatively engineered systems that maximize your performance in your specific activity, allowing you to focus on the activity instead of the equipment. From our studies have come many innovative Saucony concepts. Advanced technologies-like Grid, the first sole-based stability and cushioning system--provide an advantage to athletes of all types.
